meanings.definition: Having two wings or winglike parts.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly had dipteral wings, allowing it to flutter gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The bird's dipteral feathers helped it soar through the sky effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The toy airplane with dipteral wings looked like it could take off any moment.
meanings.sent4: Her dipteral hair clips resembled tiny butterfly wings, adding a whimsical touch to her hairstyle.
meanings.sent5: The dragonfly's dipteral wings shimmered in the sunlight, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: Having a double row of columns on all sides, as certain ancient temples.
meanings.sent1: The dipteral temple stood majestic with its grand double row of columns.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the dipteral architecture of the ancient temple, admiring its symmetry.
meanings.sent3: The dipteral building looked like it was hugging itself with all those columns.
meanings.sent4: The dipteral pillars of the temple reached towards the sky like ancient guardians.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the dipteral structure left spectators in awe of the craftsmanship.
